data.text: Vain and false hopes are for a man void of understanding;
As one that catcheth at a shadow, and followeth after the wind,
The vision of dreams is as  this thing against that,
Of an unclean thing what shall be cleansed?
Divinations, and soothsayings, and dreams, are vain:
If they be not sent from the Most High in thy  visitation,
For dreams have led many astray:
Without lying shall the law be accomplished;
A well-instructed man knoweth many things;
He that hath no experience knoweth few things:
In my wandering I have seen many things;
Ofttimes was I in danger even unto death;
The spirit of those that fear the Lord shall live;
Whoso feareth the Lord shall not be afraid, and shall not play the coward;
Blessed is the soul of him that feareth the Lord:
The eyes of the Lord are upon them that love him,
He raiseth up the soul, and enlighteneth the eyes:
He that sacrificeth of a thing wrongfully gotten, his offering is made in mockery;
The Most High hath no pleasure in the offerings of the ungodly;
As  one that killeth the son before his fatherâ€™s eyes
The bread of the needy is the life of the poor:
As  one that slayeth his neighbour is he that taketh away his living;
One building, and another pulling down,
One praying, and another cursing,
He that washeth himself after touching  a dead body, and toucheth it again,
Even so a man fasting for his sins,
